DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether a 10 week Internet-delivered CBT is a feasible approach to treat children (age 8-12 years) with anxiety disorder (social phobia, panic disorder, specific phobia, generalized anxiety disorder or separation anxiety disorder). The program is directed toward both the parents and children. The patients work with the treatment is supported through on-line contact with a therapist. Approximately 128 patients will be included in the study and randomized to either condition. All included patients are assessed before the treatment starts and after 10 weeks (post treatment). Follow-up assessments are conducted at 3 and 12 months after treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Internet-delivered Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT) for Children Age 8-12 Years With Anxiety Disorders
DOC.criteria: primary diagnosis of social phobia, panic disorder, specific phobia, generalized anxiety disorder or separation anxiety disorder, age between 8 and 12 years, ability to read and write Swedish and with access to a computer and use of internet. Presence of neuropsychiatric diagnosis or a primary psychiatric disorder other than those that the treatment aims at.
